messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Uh, burglars are breaking into a house next door.
What's the address there, sir?
7418. Not my address, but next door, okay?
Yes, sir. Do you want me to stop them?
I've got a shotgun. Do you want me to stop them?
No, don't do that. There isn't any property worth shooting somebody over, okay?
Well, they're breaking in right now.
They're inside the house?
Yes, I'm watching them.
What color is the house they're breaking into?
It's kind of a red brick right next to a two-story brick home, my home.
All right. What do the guys look like? Are they white, black, Hispanic?
They're black, two of them.
Two black males? What are they wearing?
One's got a green shirt, white tennis shoes, and blue jeans, and both of them are inside the house right now.
What is the other one wearing, sir?
I didn't get a look at the other one. But hurry up, man. Catch these guys, will you? Because I'm not going to let them go.
Stay on the phone with me until we get someone over there, okay? Don't hang up.
I'm not hanging up, but I'm telling you right now, I don't like this. This is ridiculous.
I understand, but we don't want you getting hurt. Do you see which window they went through?
The side, on the side where the gate is. You know, where the fence is, because nobody can see them.
So that would be the right-hand side, looking from the front?
Yes.
Man, this is scary. I can't believe this is happening in this neighborhood. Can you see anything at all?
No, I just see where they went in the house. I can't see inside the house.
I understand that, but you can see where they entered?
Yes.
So they might slip out the same way. Can you see the front of the house?
I can't see the front. I'll bring my shotgun with me, I swear to God.
Don't go out there. Stay inside the house.
If I go out there, what am I going to have?
No, I don't want you to go out there. I just asked if you could see anything out front, like a vehicle they arrived in?
No.
Alright. Let me know if you see anything at all. Stay inside and don't go out there. Are you still there, Mr. Horn?
I'm here. I can't see the front of the house. I can't tell if they're getting away or not.
That's alright. We have officers on the way. Do you know your neighbors well?
No, not really. I know the neighbors on the other side well. If it was their house, I'd have done something already.
Mr. Horn, listen to me carefully. We have officers on the way. Do not go outside the house and do not have that gun in your hand when officers are there.
I have a right to protect myself, and the laws have changed. I have a right to protect my property.
I understand, but it’s not worth risking your life over this.
He's coming out the window right now. I've got to stop them.
Don't go out the door. Mr. Horn, do not go outside.
They just stole something. I'm going out the door.
Don't go out the door. Do not go outside.
This isn't right. They're getting away.
Property is not worth killing someone over. Do not go outside. Don't be shooting anybody.
They got a bag, they're walking out the driveway.
How big is the bag? Which way are they going?
I'm going outside to find out.
Don't go outside, Mr. Horn.
Here it goes. I'm going.
911, we need officers over here quickly. Did you shoot someone, Mr. Horn?
Yes, I did.
Where are you right now?
I'm inside the house at 7418.
Officers are arriving. Put the gun down before you shoot an officer. There are officers outside without uniforms. Do you understand?
I'm in the front yard waving my hand.
Do you have a gun with you?
No.
Do you see a uniformed officer?
Yes.
Lay down on the ground and do what the officers tell you.
Alright.
Where's the gun?
In the house.
Where in the house?
In a chair.
Thank you.
